channel.title: Some questions
channel.description:
Well, I'm about to pick my study. I'm still thinking what I should pick, so I have a few questions for you guys.
1. How long have you been programming java? 2. Did you take a study on java programming at a school? 3. If 2 is true, how long have you been programming in java before you went to that school? 4. Do you think someone with no or a max. of .5 years java experience can do a study in java?
As you can see, I'm thinking of becoming a programmer. But I need to see if I can do it (there are no specific requirements for the study)
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Some questions
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

  1. Just over a year, I started in september 2006
  2. No
  4. Yes

I think semaphore is right about the Special Olympics idea, I started c++ a while ago, and it is a lot harder, even though I knew some java before that.
although if you think java is easy, scar is even easier, thats why its kept alive. (I guess that makes delphi easy too)

Read full topic

item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

  1. 7 Months
  2. Am/ Will Be
  3. 2 months, counting doing nothing in class
    4.No?

Read full topic

item.title: Some questions
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:11, topic:170429”]4. Java is the Special Olympics of programming languages; it’s so easy even a retard can succeed.[/quote]I think that’s more along the lines of PHP; a retard made it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Some questions
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

  1. 7 years professionally. I have forgotten more than most of the people on this forum know.
  2. When I was in college, java was a cup of coffee and a twinkle in Gosling’s eye.
  3. Didn’t exist… but I cut my teeth on C in the late 80’s. (No, I wasn’t around for the creation of C from CPL/BCPL… nor did I see the advent of the wheel).
  4. Java is the Special Olympics of programming languages; it’s so easy even a retard can succeed.

Read full topic

item.description:
@shangtsung1 wrote:

  1. 3 years on and off
  2. yep, it sucked they taught us helloworld…waste of money
  3. before i didnt do nothing
  4. you could learn more in a day then what i learnt in 3 years on and off…

item.description:

item.title: Some questions
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

  1. I have been programming Java for around 3 years.

  2. Yes, I did take a course in Java at school. And am still at University (however, I already know everything they learn, so I do not have to attend the lessons)…

  3. Before I went to school I had never programmed Java, however, I had been doing other stuff before, and since my real life friend have around 8 years of experience, he helped me some.

  4. Of course you can do that… It is all different for each and everyone. Some people don’t get it, others do (some faster than others aswell). << Experience from the University I am attending.

I am currently studying to become a programmer, and we will soon have practice on a real company… Which I have already had before.

Read full topic
